text:
Sawaddee ka welcome to hot Thai kitchen it's 
been quite a while since I've shown you guys how

to make a Thai drink so it's summer in Vancouver 
so let's do it right now so I'm gonna show you a

drink that I think is quite new I started seeing 
it appear in Thailand a couple years ago I had

it last year and I fell in love it was refreshing 
easy to make and super fun to drink so I am making

something called nam woon bai toey or nam bai toey woon 
a couple ways to say it so nam means a

drink by Peleus pandan leaves and wouldn't is agar 
agar jelly so think of this as like our version of

bubble tea but a little lighter and easier to chew 
let's get started so we're gonna make pandan tea

so we got 1/2 pandan leaves so pandan leaves for 
those of you who don't know look like this it is

an aromatic leaf it is our main flavor in Thai 
desserts it's got a very floral aroma almost a

little bit coconutty it's just so beautiful if 
you haven't tried it you gotta check it out you

can get it fresh at Asian grocery stores or more 
likely you can find it frozen what I want to do

is I'm just gonna tie it into a knot and I'm just 
tying these so that one it fits in my pod to the

act of tying them Bruce the leaves and it helps 
the aromatic juices come out more easily there

you go and then I'm just gonna drop them into 
my boiling water see and they fit perfectly now

my hand smells good now in addition to a pan 
and you can just do pandan leaves if you want

most of the drinks that I had in Thailand is just 
panin but I like to bump it up with a little bit

of lemongrass and I'm just gonna Bruce it smash it 
with my pestle here and you can use whatever heavy

things or just the back of your knife as well I'm 
just gonna cut these into chunks we alright so now

I'm gonna let this simmer for about 15 minutes 
and while that's going let's make the jelly so

for this I want the color to be a little bit more 
vibrant green so I'm gonna make pandan juice and

get all that green color in there so I'm just 
gonna cut some of my leaves here into a blender

some plain water blitz that up mmm green goodness 
so now we need to strain it so the fibers have

gotten pretty small so I find that you really 
need a super fine cloth strainer for this so a

mesh sieve isn't gonna do quite as good of a job 
time to bring out your coffee saw once again so

you've got this probably for my Thai coffee Thai 
iced tea and now you can use it for this smells

good and depending on the color of your pandan 
leaves sometimes I find if you wanna just bump

it up with a little green food coloring just for 
something a little more vibrant that's totally

fine I'm actually pretty happy with where mine 
is right now now to make my jelly I am going to

use the classic Thai jello fiying ingredient and 
that is agar agar powder you want to know more

about it you can have never heard of it I have 
a whole video talking about what it is and where

you can get it just gonna sprinkle that into my 
pandan juice here make sure this is still cold

you can for this recipe use gelatin instead it'll 
just be a different texture but when we go to put

it together there are some things to note okay 
so make sure watch to the end if you're gonna

use Jellison instead now give this a stir and 
I'm gonna bring it to a boil make sure you keep

stirring so that the powder doesn't fall all to 
the bottom with a mini whisk of course okay so

it's come to a full boil and yes as much as I 
love a mean you ask it was too short in my hand

was getting too hot so a longer spatula it is for 
this one and I want to check that it's dissolved

completely using my usual method I put some in a 
spoon I pour some off and I just check that there

are no still little tiny grains of powder still 
stuck on there and we add some sugar and you can

make this as sweet or as not sweet as you likes 
completely up to you I'm just gonna scrape off

all this green stuff off the sides because all 
that's color and it's good stuff and that's it

super easy that's the jelly and now I'm just gonna 
pour this into my mold here I'm using a large

silicone mold because I just want this to be flat 
right I want the jelly to be small otherwise you

can't suck it up with a straw and now that just 
needs to cool until it's set and then make sure

you chill it and we're almost done mmm this smells 
like a spa right now you can just use a fine mesh

skimmer to fish everything out and by the way you 
can serve this tea hot it's super soothing maybe

put a little honey on it this is actually what a 
lot of massage parlors in thailand serve you after

a massage because it's so soothing and so at this 
point the tea is done and you can sweeten it just

as sugar as much or as little as you want but I'm 
actually gonna leave it unsweetened and then serve

it with a simple syrup I like to do that with 
drinks that way people who are drinking it can

make it as sweeter it's not sweet as they want 
and to make a simple syrup it is really simple

you just do equal parts water and sugar cook it 
over heat until the sugar is completely dissolved

and that's basically it so the jelly has set and 
this is the joy of a silicone mold oops is it so

easy to get out but I still need to sort of run 
my knife along the edges it'll work it's barely

big enough huh anyway we're chopping it all up 
so it doesn't have to come out beautifully in

one piece Dada look at that and then you want to 
chop it up into really whatever size you want but

you want to make sure it's small enough that it 
will fit in whatever straw you are using so I've

seen like bubble if you got a bubble tea straw 
you can cut them big sort of bubble tea size or

if you have a regular straw just cut them into 
like really really small pieces and it's still

gonna be fun to suck up okay so I find it and 
using a mini cleaver is the best thing to do

yes and as you cut these they will kind of fly 
all over the place and you can just pick them

up and that's something you can't easily do with 
gelatin and gus' gelatin so much softer and it

also melts at a lower temperature so your warm 
hands may even melt it so that's why I got jelly

it's the way to go so now once you cut these you 
want to make sure that you don't store them in a

bowl like this that you put them in your tea and 
let it just hang out in the tea because otherwise

the nature of agar agar is that once you cut them 
like this over time the water will kind of leach

out of them which is not too bad but if you kind 
of you know you want to keep the texture and the

consistency you don't want any water leaching 
out of it right okay let's put it all together

I want a lot of jelly and then since my tea is 
not sweetened I have to add some simple syrup

so from me I find that about a tablespoon of 
simple syrup is enough but for you that could

be totally different so make sure you taste and 
adjust accordingly there's a beautiful ice tea

and by the way you do not have to wait for this 
tea to cool down before you add the jelly to it

because the nature of agar agar is it will 
not melt unless you actually like bring it

to a boil on the stove again so even if this 
is still warm even if it's hot you can still

put the jelly in it no problems not something 
you can do with gelatin you have to make sure

this is actually cold cold before you put gelatin 
in it alright some ice oh look at that we got fun

that looks then I got my bubble tea straw and 
now with the rise of popularity of non-visible

I think that is the wrong side supposed to be 
this side down anyway with the popularity of

non-disposable reusable straws they're actually 
making bubble tea sized reusable straws that you

can buy as well but I happen to have these from a 
long time ago alright let's see how it tastes mmm

so fun so refreshing just the aroma of the 
lemongrass and the pandan just worked together

so well because these are squares the way they 
enter your mouth so quickly it's just like a

really cool sensation you want it it's slightly 
sweet mmm just a fun fun drink perfect for the

summer your kids are gonna love it and you can 
also get them invokes it's super easy right so

I hope you give this a try the recipe as always 
will be on hot I am calm and when you make it

I definitely want to see a photo so shared
